intro: Sisymbrium retrofractum, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It has a short life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Sisymbrium retrofractum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
